Problem:
class VehicleSystem { constructor(trafficLevel) { this.trafficLevel = trafficLevel; } updateTrafficLevel(trafficLevel) { this.trafficLevel = trafficLevel; this.updateDelay(); } updateDelay() { if(this.trafficLevel >= 80) { this.delay = 'High'; } else if(this.trafficLevel >= 50) { this.delay = 'Moderate'; } else { this.delay = 'Low'; } } } const system = new VehicleSystem(30); system.updateTrafficLevel(90);",

If the traffic level is set to 90, will the delay be high without any intervention?
Explanation: The `updateTrafficLevel` method sets the traffic level and directly calls `updateDelay`, which sets the delay based on the traffic level. Since 90 is greater than 80, the delay is adjusted to 'High' according to the code logic.

causal_map_integration: When the traffic level is set to 90, it directly causes the delay to become high. The updateTrafficLevel method, when called with a traffic level of 90, updates the delay based on the traffic level.
